text: Fujitsu is a global technology company.
We're 10th largest IT provider in the world.
We provide services to more than 500 different countries
with more than 40 languages.

So being able to work
with a global company
that helps us understand the way to comply

with regulations has been
fundamental to our success.

The adoption of Amazon
Connect has been crucial
to our success. Since the beginning,

staff, employees, agents have
been able to see the benefits,

but also it has helped
us increase efficiencies
and maximize cost reductions.

We were able to cut down
60% of the operational costs
and almost 65% on telephony costs
and infrastructure by moving
away from a license-based model
to a pay-per-usage model.
The total cost of ownership

with Amazon Connect, once we
migrated away from the legacy
platform has been reduced by 50%.

Generative AI is a big approach
for next year. Being able

to automate, introducing
customer-assist, agent-assist

and manager-assist use cases
in which we provide the tools

needed to optimize the response
and resolution of issues.
One of the key factors

that has made Fujitsu
successful in this migration is to

look at the big picture, see
how you can improve services,
or replace features with new AWS services
and working backwards

with AWS from the customer
needs into a solution.
